titles.title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to acquire certain lands in California through an exchange pursuant to the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1749-1750)
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-362.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 196.

action.text: Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

bill.summary: 11/15/1993--Passed House amended. Deems lands designated as the Delta Point Lookout Tract in California as public lands for a 36-month period solely for purposes of exchange by the Secretary of the Interior for lands designated as the OHV Area Tract pursuant to the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. Amends the Everglades National Park Protection and Expansion Act of 1989 to authorize the Secretary to use funds appropriated pursuant to such Act, including funds appropriated for project modifications by the Army Corps of Engineers, to provide Federal assistance to the State of Florida for acquisition of lands in or adjacent to, or affecting the restoration of natural water flows to, the Everglades National Park or Florida Bay which are located east of the Park and known as the Frog Pond, Rocky Glades Agricultural Area, and the Eight-and-One-Half Square-Mile Area. Limits Federal assistance to not more than 25 percent of the total cost of such acquisition.
